Background and Analysis:
	 
All community college districts are required to submit their annual report of financial revenue and expenditures to the state Chancellor’s Office at the conclusion of each fiscal year. This report is known as the CCFS 311. The report submitted for our district is attached. In addition to the summary of actual expenses, there is supplemental information included in this report, including analysis of our net ending balance, analysis of compliance with the 50% law, detail of general fund revenues, expenditures by activity and the lottery proceeds expense report. A copy of the report is available for public viewing in the Vice Chancellor of Business Services’ Office and at http://business.fhda.edu/_downloads/CCFS311FY201415.pdf.
	 
	 
	 
Submitted by:
 Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor, Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
 Hector Quinonez, Executive Director, Fiscal Services, x6250
Is backup provided?
 Yes

Background and Analysis:
	 
Education Code Section 84040(b) requires that each governing board of each community college district provide an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations issued by the Board of Governors.  
	 
Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) Statement No. 68 – Accounting and Financial Reporting for Pensions was effective for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2015.  The primary objective of this Statement is to improve accounting and financial reporting by state and local governments for pensions. In the case of our District, this covers the accounting and financial reporting of our representative share of the CalPERS and CalSTRS pension obligation.
	 
Under GASB Statement No. 67 – Financial Reporting for Pension Plans, CalPERS and CalSTRS were required to undertake an actuarial study and an audit of their respective pension plans.  Based on the CalPERS and CalSTRS actuarial studies and audit reports, the District is required to recognize its proportionate share of the collective pension expense, report deferred outflows of resources, and deferred inflows of resources related to each of the pension plans.
	 
Most recently, as of one week ago, CalPERS revised their audited numbers.  CalSTRS had also undergone a restatement of their numbers some time earlier.  With the delay in obtaining accurate audited information from CalPERS and CalSTRS, the District audit report has subsequently been delayed as well. 
	 
Vavrinek, Trine, Day, & Company, LLP, Certified Public Accountants, located in Pleasanton, California, is working to complete the Foothill-De Anza Community College District annual audit for the year ended June 30, 2015 in time to present it to the Board of Trustees for acceptance at their regularly scheduled Board meeting of January 11, 2016.
	 
We will bring a copy of the audit report to the Audit and Finance Committee at their regularly scheduled meeting of March 10, 2016.
	 
	 
Submitted by:
 Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor, Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
 Hector Quinonez, Executive Director, Fiscal Services, x6250
